alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 05 at 2:47PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of east central California, including the following county, Mono. * WHEN...Until 400 PM PDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff from rapid snowmelt will continue to produce minor flooding of creeks, streams, and other flood-prone locations. Rural roads and campgrounds could be impacted where creeks and streams rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 238 PM PDT, minor flooding is ongoing or likely to occur near smaller creeks and streams in the advisory area into the weekend, as warm temperatures continue to melt the high elevation snowmelt. - Locations affected include areas near Green Creek, Lee Vining Creek, Rush Creek, McGee Creek and other small streams in Mono County. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Anyone planning outdoor recreation in Mono County should be prepared to adjust plans due to flood impacts. The highest flows on creeks often occur at night or early in the morning.
